segment.source: Configure the Start layout
segment.target: Configure the Start layout

segment.source: Configure the Start layout
segment.target: Configure the Start layout

segment.source: You can now easily configure the default Start layout to include Web links, secondary tiles, folders, and apps.
segment.target: You can now easily configure the default Start layout to include Web links, secondary tiles, folders, and apps.

segment.source: The converged Windows 10 Start layout requires that you create a LayoutModification.xml file, which we'll create in this walkthrough.
segment.target: The converged Windows 10 Start layout requires that you create a LayoutModification.xml file, which we'll create in this walkthrough.

segment.source: Note The schema for the LayoutModification.xml file is different from the MCSF customization answer file schema or the Windows provisioning answer file schema.
segment.target: Note The schema for the LayoutModification.xml file is different from the MCSF customization answer file schema or the Windows provisioning answer file schema.

segment.source: You will need to use the LayoutModification.xml to fully take advantage of the Start customization in Windows 10 and you can use the Start settings in either MCSF or Windows Provisioning to reference LayoutModification.xml.
segment.target: You will need to use the LayoutModification.xml to fully take advantage of the Start customization in Windows 10 and you can use the Start settings in either MCSF or Windows Provisioning to reference LayoutModification.xml.

segment.source: If you are not new to Windows mobile development and were using pre-existing MCSF settings pertaining to the Start layout, we highly recommend that you switch to a LayoutModification.xml to take full advantage of the Start experience.
segment.target: If you are not new to Windows mobile development and were using pre-existing MCSF settings pertaining to the Start layout, we highly recommend that you switch to a LayoutModification.xml to take full advantage of the Start experience.

segment.source: Also note that not all pre-existing MCSF Start settings are supported in Windows 10.
segment.target: Also note that not all pre-existing MCSF Start settings are supported in Windows 10.

segment.source: In this walkthrough, we will:
segment.target: In this walkthrough, we will:

segment.source: Create two versions of the Start layout, one with a folder and another without a folder.
segment.target: Create two versions of the Start layout, one with a folder and another without a folder.

segment.source: Configure the MCSF Start layout settings to specify that we are using the new layout modification XML for our layout, creating variants in the CAF file, and specifying which Start layout applies to the variants we've created.
segment.target: Configure the MCSF Start layout settings to specify that we are using the new layout modification XML for our layout, creating variants in the CAF file, and specifying which Start layout applies to the variants we've created.

segment.source: Note Make sure you've read Start layout for Windows 10 mobile editions before doing this walkthrough.
segment.target: Note Make sure you've read Start layout for Windows 10 mobile editions before doing this walkthrough.

segment.source: The topic provides more detailed information about each element in LayoutModification.xml, which is not covered in this walkthrough, as well as limitations and restrictions that you need to be aware of.
segment.target: The topic provides more detailed information about each element in LayoutModification.xml, which is not covered in this walkthrough, as well as limitations and restrictions that you need to be aware of.

segment.source: To configure the Start layout modification file
segment.target: To configure the Start layout modification file

segment.source: Create a file called LayoutModification1.xml.
segment.target: Create a file called LayoutModification1.xml.

segment.source: Add the XML code to:
segment.target: Add the XML code to:

segment.source: Pin a medium-sized tile on row 6, column 0.
segment.target: Pin a medium-sized tile on row 6, column 0.

segment.source: The tile is for the MSN News app.
segment.target: The tile is for the MSN News app.

segment.source: Pin a medium-sized tile on row 6, column 2.
segment.target: Pin a medium-sized tile on row 6, column 2.

segment.source: The tile is a Web link for the Contoso home page.
segment.target: The tile is a Web link for the Contoso home page.

segment.source: Pin a small-sized folder on row 6, column 4.
segment.target: Pin a small-sized folder on row 6, column 4.

segment.source: The folder name is "Contoso apps" and it contains the following:
segment.target: The folder name is "Contoso apps" and it contains the following:

segment.source: A medium-sized tile for the MSN Apps app.
segment.target: A medium-sized tile for the MSN Apps app.

segment.source: A medium-sized tile for the MSN Money app.
segment.target: A medium-sized tile for the MSN Money app.

segment.source: The following XML example shows what you need to add to the LayoutModification.xml file.
segment.target: The following XML example shows what you need to add to the LayoutModification.xml file.

segment.source: Save the xml file and note the location of the file; for example, C:ContosoCustomizationsLayoutModification1.xml.
segment.target: Save the xml file and note the location of the file; for example, C:ContosoCustomizationsLayoutModification1.xml.

segment.source: Using the same xml file, now save it as LayoutModification2.xml.
segment.target: Using the same xml file, now save it as LayoutModification2.xml.

segment.source: Modify the contents of the new LayoutModification2.xml file by deleting everything within the start:Folder element and replacing that folder tile location with the MSN Money app.
segment.target: Modify the contents of the new LayoutModification2.xml file by deleting everything within the start:Folder element and replacing that folder tile location with the MSN Money app.

segment.source: The contents of your XML file should look like this:
segment.target: The contents of your XML file should look like this:

segment.source: Save the xml file and note the location of the file; for example, C:ContosoCustomizationsLayoutModification2.xml.
segment.target: Save the xml file and note the location of the file; for example, C:ContosoCustomizationsLayoutModification2.xml.

segment.source: Add the layout modification files and configure the Start layout settings in the MCSF CAF or Windows Provisioning answer file (WPAF).
segment.target: Add the layout modification files and configure the Start layout settings in the MCSF CAF or Windows Provisioning answer file (WPAF).

segment.source: For MCSF: See Configure the Start layout in Configure customization settings.
segment.target: For MCSF: See Configure the Start layout in Configure customization settings.

segment.source: For Windows Provisioning: If you are using the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) UI, see Configure the Start layout in Use the Windows ICD UI to customize and build a mobile image.
segment.target: For Windows Provisioning: If you are using the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) UI, see Configure the Start layout in Use the Windows ICD UI to customize and build a mobile image.

segment.source: If you are using the Windows ICD CLI (hybrid method), see Configure the Start layout in Use the Windows ICD CLI to customize and build a mobile image.
segment.target: If you are using the Windows ICD CLI (hybrid method), see Configure the Start layout in Use the Windows ICD CLI to customize and build a mobile image.
